intro: [WRONG START] Boronia laevigata, commonly known as the smooth boronia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its aromatic, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically appearing in spring. The plant has smooth, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in heathlands and open forests. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants. Borbonia laevigata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
